snippet: Over the next 10 years, billions of dollars from the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, and from the airlines themselves, will be spent to improve the functionality and the images of New York’s three major airports.
abstract: Billions of dollars are being spent to improve the functionality at New York's three major airports--La Guardia and Kennedy International in Queens and Newark Liberty International in New Jersey; Delta's corridors at La Guardia are now filled with bar-height seating and counters crowned with tablets that customers can use to order food and drinks, check on their flights and more.
